revised_title: On a Class of Dynamical Problems: Continuous-Impact Dynamics
tldr: The author presents a new approach to solving a class of dynamical problems, known as continuous-impact problems, where a system interacts with particles of infinitesimal mass. The author derives equations of motion for these problems and applies them to a specific scenario involving a heavy chain hanging over the edge of a table, demonstrating the motion of the chain under the influence of gravity.
